import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.image as mpimg
img = mpimg.imread('../input/timesteps/time-steps.jpg')
plt.figure(figsize=(20,15))
imgplot = plt.imshow(img)
plt.show()
source.69e6cea0: **5. In my opinion, 3 features of Wi-Fi, magnetic field and beacon can be used for modeling.**
source.97b1803a: **In the image below, you can see the time steps of the various features in the text files. Wi-Fi signals are updated every 2 seconds but waypoints are given every 10 seconds. Magnetic field and beacon features are almost present.**
source.cc95ce0c: **3. The number of Wi-Fi signals in each update is different.**
source.e475a91a: **7. It is better to use BSSID of WiFi which is equivalent to device MAC address.**
source.00880d95: **2. Wi-Fi signals are updated every 2 seconds but waypoints are given every 10 seconds.**
source.a1d574d9: **1. In text files, timestamps and features values are not sorted by time! You need to sort them out before working with them.**
source.124a3131: **4. It seems that it is better to use signals that are closer to the waypoints based on time to training the model.**
source.9827a06e:

source.16639940: **6. To improve the model, the floor feature (which has been predicted with high accuracy) can be added to the feature set.**
